chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M Risch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Ct 1 & 2: Costs due as a condition of probation by payment plan of $200 a month beginning 12/18/15. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact with either victim (Female 1 & Female 2 as listed in criminal complaint) or their families.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 yrs unless approved by agent.

Comply with any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Register with Sex Offender Registry
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge

Defendant Eric M Risch in court with attorney George Andrew Limbeck.  Defendant in custody from Ozaukee County Jail. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver form filed. Defendant Eric M Risch appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel waives reading and advises the defendant plans on retaining private counsel. Court finds probable cause on the complaint.   State requesting $10,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $10,000 cash bail w/conditions:  no contact with any females under age 17; not to leave the State of WI.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
